title: Looking for Monospace / Fixed Width font.
content:
Hey guys,  
I tried really hard to find the font used in the images attached. It's a kind of Monospace / Fixed Width font, but has several special thingies, like the dots in the "Ü" (yes, I'm German). Anyone can help? Thanks!

Font: 

 Neubauladen NB55 RMS by Stephan Gandl 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131648/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Bildschirmfoto 2014-12-03 um 13.02.10.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131648/http:/typophile.com/files/Bildschirmfoto%202014-12-03%20um%2013.02.10.jpg) | 57.07 KB |
| [Bildschirmfoto 2014-12-03 um 11.58.24.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131648/http:/typophile.com/files/Bildschirmfoto%202014-12-03%20um%2011.58.24.jpg) | 57.03 KB |
author: spacespencer

comments.content: Only alternatives at the moment: [ASCA-D](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131648/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/font/T0444/asca-d), [Bennu Sans A](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131648/http:/www.hypefortype.com/bennu-sans-a.html), [Saber Rund](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131648/http:/www.hypefortype.com/browse-fonts/font-categories/headline/ne-saber-rund-8264.html)
Thank you! I've stumbled across Bennu Sans myself (amongst several others), but I guess I need the exact font (notice also the "A" and the strike-though zero).

Yep, almost there. Maybe they modified the "Ü" manually?  
See:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131648im_/http:/typophile.com/files/letters_4846.jpg)

Wait, it does have the special characters (which I've seen after I baught it):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131648im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SPECIALS_6225.jpg)
So I say: solved! Thank you very much for your help! :)
